question: Find the Laplace transform of the periodic waveform shown in <image 1>.
description:
The image depicts a periodic square wave function \( f(t) \) plotted against time \( t \). The waveform has the following characteristics:

- The amplitude of the waveform is constant at 1.
- The period of the waveform is denoted by \( T \).
- Within each period \( T \), the waveform is non-zero for half the period, specifically from \( t = 0 \) to \( t = T/2 \), and zero for the other half, from \( t = T/2 \) to \( t = T \).
- The waveform repeats itself every \( T \) units of time.

The waveform can be described mathematically as follows:
\[ f(t) = 
\begin{cases} 
1 & \text{for } 0 \leq t < T/2 \\
0 & \text{for } T/2 \leq t < T 
\end{cases}
\]
and this pattern repeats periodically with period \( T \).

This description should enable someone to determine the Laplace transform of the given periodic waveform.
